jaxl.models package¶

Submodules¶

jaxl.models.common module¶

class jaxl.models.common.EncoderPredictorModel(encoder: Model, predictor: Model, encoder_name: str = 'encoder', predictor_name: str = 'predictor')¶

Bases: Model

Model with two components: encoder and prediction function. The encoder can be seen as a model that embeds observation into a representation space. The prediction function makes prediction after taking an input from the representation space.

encode: Callable[[FrozenDict[str, Mapping[str, Any]] | Dict[str, Any], Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number], Tuple[Array | ndarray | bool_ | number, Array | ndarray | bool_ | number]]¶

Encode input to representation space.

init(model_key: PRNGKey, dummy_x: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Initialize model parameters.

Parameters:

  • model_key (jrandom.PRNGKey) – the random number generation key for initializing parameters

  • dummy_x (chex.Array) – the input data

Returns:

the initialized parameters for both the encoder and the predictor

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

class jaxl.models.common.EnsembleModel(model: Model, num_models: int)¶

Bases: Model

Ensemble Model. We assume all models are identical.
